servinfo.title: DTC P0140: O2 Sensor (HO2S) Circuit No Activity Detected (Sensor-2)

servinfosub.title: Wiring Diagram
servinfosub.ptxt: Refer to DTC P0137 / P0138: O2 Sensor (HO2S) Circuit Low Voltage / High Voltage (Sensor-2) .

servinfosub.title: DTC Detecting Condition and Trouble Area

entry.ptxt: HO2S-2 voltage is higher than specified value after warming up engine (circuit open).

item.ptxt: When performing a road test, select a place where there is no traffic or possibility of a traffic accident and be very careful during testing to avoid occurrence of an accident.
Road test should be carried out by 2 persons, a driver and a tester, on a level road.

s1.ptxt: With ignition switch turned OFF, connect scan tool.
Turn ON ignition switch and clear DTC using scan tool.
Start engine and warm up to normal operating temperature.
Increase vehicle speed to 60 – 80 km/h (37 – 50 mile/h) at 5th gear or D range.
Release accelerator pedal and with engine brake applied, keep vehicle coasting (with fuel cut for 4 sec. or more), then stop vehicle and run engine at idle speed for 60 sec. or more.

attention3.ptxt: Before this trouble shooting is performed, read the precautions for DTC troubleshooting referring to Precautions For DTC Troubleshooting .

testgroup.question: Was “Engine and Emission Control System Check” performed?

action.ptxt: Go to Engine and Emission Control System Check .

test1.ptxt: Disconnect connector from HO2S-2 with ignition switch turned OFF.
Check for proper connection to HO2S-2 connector at “PNK”, “BLK/RED”, “GRN” and “RED” wire terminals.
If connections are OK, measure resistance between “GRN” wire terminal of HO2S-2 connector and engine ground.

paragroup.ptxt: “GRN” and/or “GRY/GRN” wire is open or high resistance circuit. Poor “C37-57” terminal connection. Faulty ECM ground.
If they are OK, substitute a known-good ECM and recheck.

test1.ptxt: Disconnect connectors from ECM with ignition switch turned OFF.
Measure resistance between “RED” wire terminal of HO2S-2 connector and “C37-11” terminal of ECM connector.

paragroup.ptxt: “RED” wire is high resistance circuit or open circuit. Poor “C37-11” terminal connection.
If they are OK, substitute a known-good ECM and recheck.

test1.ptxt: Measure voltage between “RED” wire terminal of HO2S-2 connector and vehicle body ground.

action.ptxt: “RED” wire is shorted to other circuit.

test1.ptxt: Check HO2S-2 heater circuit referring to DTC P0037 / P0038: HO2S Heater Control Circuit Low / High (Sensor-2) .

action.ptxt: Repair HO2S-2 circuit. If circuit is OK, substitute a known-good ECM and recheck.

test1.ptxt: Check HO2S-2 referring to Heated Oxygen Sensor (HO2S-2) Heater On-Vehicle Inspection .

paragroup.ptxt: Substitute a known-good ECM and recheck.
